instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: 820-2879 came in not powering on w/ No water damage. Found dead short on PPBUS_G3H... Ran power found Q7035 getting very hot... Replaced it short gone, Got a green light w/o fan spin... PPBUS_G3H voltage was 3v. ISL had a hole burned through it so I replaced it.... No green light... Checked my soldering and even tried a new chip. I decided to measure PPBUS_G3H again and it was dead shorted AGAIN. Ran power, found the same mosfet getting hot... Removed it and short gone.... Stumped... What could keep causing the mosfet to burn out. Thank's Duke or Louis in advance.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message:
Replace U7000, Q7030 and Q7035 at the same time, aslo check R7005 and resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28........

Resistance between pins 27/28 should be about 3ohm
Resistance between pins 17/18 should be about 20ohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Current sense is OK. Replaced U7000 twice

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Out of mosfets....  Ordered a bunch more... will arrive next week

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Had 2 mosfets come in for another 2879, So I replaced both Q7035 and Q7030 and shorted again... Clueless

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 20093"]Replace U7000, Q7030 and Q7035 at the same time[/QUOTE]

If you replace ISL and do not replace mosfets, the shorted mosfet will burn the isl, now you replace mosfets but ISL is bad and will burn mosfet, this will happen endlessly...........

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Thank you... That makes sense... Mosfets will be here next week ordered a bunch.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Got the mosfets.... Replaced them and the ISL... No change... r7005 is good.. PPBUS_G3H still dead w/o green light.. No short to ground on PPBUSg3h or pp3v42. Replaced u6900 and u6901 as well with no change.... PP3V42 is present and chrgr L gate has continuity to mosfets from ISL..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: It's the SMC. Sysonewire is missing... Replaced u6900 and u6901.. SMC BC ACOK is present but still nothing. This is a rabbit hole.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Still PPBUS should come on with 12.3V with a dead SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] This is is really strange.... Replaced the fets... Replaced the ISL... R7005 is good.. Current sense is good... PPBUS is dead.. 3v42 is good... Don't know what else it could be... No shrt on PPBUS either... Maybe something to do with SMC_BC ACOK?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Sense resistor circuit. No green light either? ACOK high?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: I think I am getting trolled by a bad from the Reel ISL.... ACOK was low I believe.. I'll take another shot at in a day or so... No voltage on Chargr L Phase... It had PPBUS G3H before I replaced the fets and the ISL but it was high at 16V... So i think I just put on a dud ISL... Will update. And yes current sense is OK. No Green light..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] OK... I have restored PPBUS. However, Still no green light.. I'm thinking bad SMC or u6900...

Adapter Sense = 1.09v
Sys One wire is jumping between .30 and .75 v
SMC BC ACOK _VCC is  0.13 v 
SMC BC ACOK is 3.21 v 
PPBUS_G3H is 12.23v So the SMC is on? 
PP3v42 is 3.42v .... 

So right now I am leaning towards a dead SMC or dead u6900...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Forgot to add... SMC_Reset_L is 3.41 v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: looks more like something is bringing SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC down. i would remove u6900 and test for voltage at pin 1, if voltage is back to 3.4v (assuming you've already replaced the magsafe jack) then i would say smc issue try reflow if same issue replace smc.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: I just reballed the SMC... No change..  Removed u6900 no change... Maybe u6901 is bad?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message:
didnt want u too reball the smc. what was the voltage on pin 1 of u6900 after you removed u6900? this would have told you if u have an issue on the sys_onewire bi-directional line. this still doesnt eliminate a bad smc. Lets hope u didnt reball a bad smc.
Remove u6900, plug in and see what the voltage is at pad #1 of where u6900 used to be. what is the voltage?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: [USER="451"]jgraffis[/USER] I know you didn't want me to reball it, But I wanted to do it just to rule out if there was crap under it... The voltage was the same on SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC  with u6900 removed ,I forgot to include that in the above post.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: So it was about .70 v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: that should rule out bad smc. some how u have a problem between u6900 and u6901. i would test resistance on r6929, and then check rresistance to ground from pad 1 on u6900 to pin 4 of u6901. kinda sounds like the trace is bad or R6929 is screwed and bringing down the voltage from u6901. report back with findings please.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Made a mistake and posted from a smoothbrain moment... Delete this post..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: [USER="451"]jgraffis[/USER] ... Trace was blown... Ran a wire but still no green light... But we have 3.41 V now

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Onewire and adapter sense are both at 3.40v now but no green light

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: I've had a board with the same adapter sense and onewire readings before.... u6900 is bad... And of course it's stolen off all my donors... More on the way thogh

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: If SLC_bcacok and 3.42 is present then you have an smc issue

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Also make sure the old trace is not shorted to ground. This is unlikely but had it happen to me. The smc should be sending signal for green light. I would replace smc next.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: I've had onewire and Adapter sense be the same 3.4 v and U6900 was bad... When I was troubleshooting this board I replaced u6900 from one I had on my mat... now that I think about it, that u6900 that I used may have been a bad one

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: No shrt on trace

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Put old u6900 back on

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: [USER="451"]jgraffis[/USER] No idea where it went lol... More are on the way

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: Mark as solved now fixed

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: well what was the fix?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 Q7035 Keeps shorting to gnd
threads.message: @igraffis... The wire from u6900 to u6901... Then I got trolled by a bad DC in board... Plus the ISL and q7030 and 35.
